posts.post_content:
On constructed: First off, there are better options. If we ignore that, there is still the part about how you want to give your opponents as few options as possible, and this gives them the option of getting rid of your "removal" spell.
  
On limited: One copy is usually fine in a sealed deck, but if you have two your opponent can usually play around them via sideboard ([Hornet Sting](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hornet Sting), [Diminish](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Diminish), [Stabbing Pain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stabbing Pain), [Primal Cocoon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primal Cocoon), [Holy Strength](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Holy Strength), [Unholy Strength](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unholy Strength)) if not main deck. Pick it no earlier than mid-pack.
posts.html:

Posted By: Quentil (8/20/2012 10:51:48 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: There are obviously better cards, Journey to Nowhere, Oblivion Ring, heck even Pacifism could be considered better. In blue there are other lockdown cards as well. This card may not be the next Stoneforge Mystic but it is good. It shines in casual. At 2cmc and common it comes into play early and is easily obtainable. It will shut down any early threat and will typically be used against a creature your opponent may not feel is even worth bailing out which means they will typically just play around it instead of breaking your cage. Its great against tempo and weenie decks if you are playing a slower control deck. Drop this on a Warcry critter or something and all the sudden your opponent is fighting just a little bit harder to get his strat going. It definitely has its place and I feel it deserves a better reputation.
posts.html:
